Seed.Tag2: Illnessin its powdered form, the bark of alstonia macrophylla (alstonia macrophylla), also known as hard milkwood or batino, is used in wine preparation and as an antipyretic, traditional remedy and preventive concoction, medicine for dysentery, an aid in the menstrual cycle, treatment in alzheimer's disease through down regulation of acetylcholine, and in wound healing.

Relation.Pattern: in its powdered form, the bark of alstonia macrophylla (alstonia macrophylla), also known as hard milkwood or batino, is used in wine preparation and as an antipyretic, traditional remedy and preventive concoction, medicine for dysentery, an aid in the menstrual cycle, treatment in alzheimer's disease through down regulation of acetylcholine, and in wound healing.
